title: Sudan: War between Khartoum rivals takes on an ethnic dimension in Darfur
description: In the west of the country, the fighting has turned into a conflict between the Janjaweed militias supported by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and non-Arab communities who have formed self-defense groups.

title: British lawmakers vote to strip Boris Johnson of parliamentary pass over Covid-19 party lies
description: Britain’s House of Commons on Monday resoundingly endorsed a report that found Boris Johnson lied to lawmakers about lockdown-flouting parties in his office.

title: France defeats Greece in Euro 2024 qualifying
description: French captain Kylian Mbappe's penalty at the Stade de France on Monday was the sole goal of the game but was enough to lead France to a narrow 1-0 victory.

title: Macron calls on Europe to develop its own airspace defense systems
description: The French president advocated for European airspace defense autonomy and to reduce reliance on the US amidst Russia's aggression in Ukraine.

title: Vancouver's Chinese community is closely watched by Beijing
description: Election-meddling, the takeover of Chinese-language media, surveillance: China is trying to manipulate the diaspora living in British Columbia to ensure its 'loyalty' to the 'motherland.'

title: One year later, the far right's credibility in Parliament is still a work in progress
description: One year ago, Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National party made an electoral breakthrough, clinching 88 seats in the Assemblée Nationale. While its 'necktie strategy' may be bearing fruit, it is still struggling to build up expertise.

title: Search launched for missing submersible that brings tourists to view Titanic
description: It was initially unclear how many people were onboard the vessel that tours the wreckage of the Titanic.

title: Michel Spinosa: 'Nazi images must be used ethically in documentaries'
description: The director and screenwriter denounces the lucrative business around the use of Nazi propaganda films to illustrate documentaries about the Second World War and the Holocaust.

title: French government presents plan to take on 'over-tourism'
description: The government unveiled a plan to better regulate tourist flows and support local authorities experiencing surges in visitor numbers.

title: UN adopts treaty to protect high seas
description: This 'historic achievement' will protect more than 60% of the world's oceans.

title: Germany: CDU hangs onto Merkel's centrist heritage though pressured by fast-growing far right
description: At the Christian Democratic Union congress in Berlin on June 16 and 17, party leader Friedrich Merz confirmed his determination to maintain distance from far-right AfD.

title: India's budget carrier IndiGo makes record order for 500 Airbus jets
description: Europe's Airbus announced a record order for 500 jets on the opening day of the Paris Air Show on Monday.

title: Henri d'Anselme, Annecy's 'backpack man': A hero in spite of himself
description: The man who chased the assailant in a knife attack on June 8 found himself propelled the next day onto TV and social media as a figure of good against evil.

title: Paris Air Show highlights search for more fuel-efficient aircraft
description: Before the arrival of carbon-neutral aircraft planned for 2050 at best, manufacturers are working on more frugal designs. Several concepts are being studied, from flying wings to biomimicry.

title: Europe is world's fastest warming continent, finds climate report
description: The world has warmed an average of nearly 1.2C since the mid-1800s, unleashing a devastating cascade of extreme weather, including more intense heatwaves.

title: Residents of Nikopol, Ukraine, wait 'to see if water returns'
description: The destruction of the Kakhovka hydroelectric dam on June 6 caused the reservoir that supplied the town and surrounding farms to dry up.

title: Manouchian's induction to Panthéon celebrates French Resistance's universalist spirit
description: Missak Manouchian, who was shot by the Nazis in 1944, will become the first foreign Resistance fighter to enter the Panthéon. His remains will be accompanied by those of his wife, Mélinée Manouchian, in a ceremony on February 21, 2024.

title: France outlines counter-offer to Germany's anti-missile defense project
description: A conference initiated by France on European air defense, held on June 19 in conjunction with the Paris Air Show, is an opportunity to examine alternative proposals to the Berlin-led 'Sky Shield.'

title: The Rhône, an industrial river facing crucial decisions
Chinese PM Li visits Germany and France on first trip abroad
description: Li Qiang arrived in Berlin on Monday and will take part in the Summit for a New Global Financing Pact in Paris later this week.

title: Missak Manouchian at the Panthéon: Lessons for today
description: The Armenian genocide survivor and Communist fighter in the French Resistance will be reburied in the Parisian mausoleum. President Emmanuel Macron is unquestionably making a judicious choice, conveying strong and welcome messages.

title: Hellfest's success continues despite controversy
description: The 16th edition of the metal festival drew to a close this weekend in Clisson, western France, with acts including Porcupine Tree and Pantera.

title: Australia set for landmark Indigenous rights referendum
description: Australia's Senate has voted to hold a referendum this year on creating an Indigenous Voice to Parliament, a mechanism aiming to give the nation's most disadvantaged ethnic minority more say on government policy.

title: Battle during Israeli raid in West Bank kills 3, wounds many
description: At least 29 were reported wounded in the city of Jenin.

title: Blinken opens second day of talks in Beijing on mission to ease tensions
description: Beijing's top diplomat told his US counterpart that the US must choose between 'cooperation or conflict' on the final day of Antony Blinken's trip to ease tensions with China on Monday.

title: Paris Air Show: Industry cannot escape paradox of flying in time of climate change
description: While there are more and more aircraft orders, the Paris Air Show, which runs until June 25, is trying to focus on the theme of decarbonization.

title: Young neo-Nazis fascinated by jihadists head to court
description: Alexandre Gilet and three accomplices will go on trial from Monday for a planned far-right attack. He was obsessed with the idea of 'avenging' the 2015 Islamist terrorist attacks in France, and drafted a 'manifesto' in which he set out his ideology and targets.

title: Russia's Navalny faces decades in prison in new trial
description: The opposition leader is already serving a nine-year prison sentence on embezzlement charges. He is now accused of financing extremist ideology and 'rehabilitating the Nazi ideology'.

title: French wages continue to lag behind inflation
description: Labor Ministry statistics for the first quarter show that wages are lagging behind prices by an average of 1% year-on-year.

title: North Korean officials lambast failed satellite launch, vow second attempt
description: Spy satellite crashed soon after liftoff last May, a major setback for the country's push to build surveillance system.

title: Trump criticized by Republican opponents over docs case
description: Several contenders for the GOP nomination next year are distancing themselves from the former president.
